name: Middleware
body: ### Introduction Middleware is a layer that exists between any two components. It acts as a mediator for the components and provides an extra capability for flexible communication. Introducing such layer has is own trade-off but the advantage weigh more than the overhead it introduces. ### Aim Is to design a platform independent Middleware that facilitates wireless communication on mobile devices by using simple interfaces available through the library designed here. ``` $ git clone https://github.com/Sirack/Middleware.git $ git checkout with_tcp ``` ### Design The design of the Middleware is divided into three parts. The first section is network creation where devices send their connection profile to the central access point. Next, near by peers are delivered to nodes once they join the network and subsequently updated reflecting the changes in the network. The full design steps are discussed in the ### Implementation The proposed design is implemented using the programming language java. You can clone the repository to get details about the Middleware. You can also checkout three independent application that are based on this Middleware. ### License The Project is free and open source. http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html ### Authors and Contributors The project was developed by Sirack Hailu (@Sirack) and Nahom Asfaw in partial fulfillment for their BSC degree in Electrical and Computer engineering.
